newsitem.title: UK: Resilient UK stocks pare losses as Dow rebounds.
newsitem.headline: Resilient UK stocks pare losses as Dow rebounds.

text.p: The London stock market ended on a resilient note on Thursday, clawing back most of the losses triggered mid-afternoon by a smaller-than-expected rise in U.S. jobless claims which hit U.S. equities and debt prices.
The FTSE 100 share index had dropped as low as 3,981.2 points in the afternoon as U.S. shares sagged in early trade.
But bid speculation, gains among insurers and Wall Street's subsequent rebound dragged the FTSE back up to end at 3,994.7, down 14.6 points on the day.
"There was a desperate struggle to get back over 4,000 but momentum just faded," one dealer said.
